It is just frustrating me because I am a bit of a grammar and spelling nerd and like things to read well. That and I normally type on a computer keyboard so...yeah. I just have to take it slow.
Like if you move/paint with the stylus or mouse, it smooths the lines
Huh...why though? Is that not part of drawing? With practice you can draw pretty smoothly, though I guess it is great for people with less practice or just starting out.
With a mouse I can totally understand. That is just a disaster.
Can help with stuff like jitter from your hands
I also think Photoshop includes this somewhat
But practice is very good, although a tablet without a screen is slightly harder than paper

I don't have so much a problem with jitter or drawing all that much, it is getting the proportions right that I need practice with. Especially with getting what I see in my head down with my hand. I have a slight disconnect there.
But that is what I think is great about drawing digitally. I can just undo instead of erase, erase, erase, ersae every time I draw on paper.

The best advice I can give is just practice sketching without ever erasing or in this case undoing. Make the image what you want. Go over tte lines to get tge end result. This is great to hone your skills and lets you feel like you are making progress.
Been drawing since I was 15, 21 now and things seem a similar difficulty to that when I started. Good idea, will try
Yeah, I have not been drawing long but I do have a talent. Or at least Iam capable. I have drawn a numbe
Some formal advice andvteachings has also helped.
That and personal experiences of redrawing over and over stuck on just getting start
Yeah, I got to say that TwoKinds (especially these streams) helped teach and encourage me more :)

Also very good practice, every time you draw spend 5 or 10 monutes filling a page with circles and very long, single stroke lines. Build up that muscle memore. Also, you may have heard of this, but draw with your should not your elbow. Your elbow should.

Yeah, the comic is what inspired the dream I had that made me want to create s comic! And here I am looking forward to drawing, something I thought I would never look gorward to after my last experience with it.
I figured some of the stuff the expensive tuition was telling me has got to have some bases.

Where/how did you learn to draw?

Well, most of my drawing cane from my community college where I learned to draft by hand. Super staight lines and perfect angles with soecific perspectives. The expensive tuition bit was my one semester spent at ASU where I took drawing classes to

become an industrial designer. I later decided thst was not the right major nor career path, but I did build up a portfolio, learned some things, and learned to draw more artistically but with a purpose.
Yeah I was just self taught (someday class). Also how did you get into furries :)

One big take away I had was that any phisical limitations can be ironed with practice, lots of it. The hard part was seeing it which I was lucky enough to be born with. So the real challenge for me is getting my visions down, iron out my physical
limitations and work on drawing orfanically, people and such.

I think I just do not ind it because a lot of my childhood was spent watching those animal kids movies like Lion King, etc. So as I got older a more humanoid versions of animals did not seem to be that outlandish to me.
That and I see furry characters differently, though made to be human they clearly are not so having had a rough childhood I associated myself with these characters more tgan anything else.
Pretty much the same, don't know when it started exatly for me Slycooper/Sonic possibly?
Yeah...the furry community is commonly associated with porn snd sex and whatever but hey, I don't want those people here anyway.
And even so, thinking so of these characters is a lot better in my opinion then some of the shit humans think of for each other.
I love dressing up as a horse snd gaging myself, bring out the leash.
That, and I have found those part of a furry community have more lax views on what is human. We all associate with these characters others see an animals.
